entry.title: Boron-mediated modular assembly of tetrasubstituted alkenes (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Boron-mediated modular assembly of tetrasubstituted alkenes

A method based on boron-mediated assembly is described for the synthesis of tetrasubstituted alkenes, molecules with four substituents around the central C=C bond, with complete control over the double-bond geometry.

  • Liang Wei
  • Mihai V. Popescu
  • Varinder K. Aggarwal
ArticleOpen Access02 Jul 2025

entry.title: Stereodivergent transformation of a natural polyester to enantiopure PHAs (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Stereodivergent transformation of a natural polyester to enantiopure PHAs

Stereoselective synthetic routes use P3HB (a polyester produced by bacteria) as a chiral feedstock for related polymers that have properties more amenable to processing and use.

  • Jun-Jie Tian
  • Ruirui Li
  • Eugene Y.-X. Chen
Article02 Jul 2025

entry.title: Mapping the adaptive landscape of Batesian mimicry using 3D-printed stimuli (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Mapping the adaptive landscape of Batesian mimicry using 3D-printed stimuli

Birds have an excellent ability to learn to discriminate harmless insects from those that they mimic on the basis of subtle differences in appearance.

  • Christopher H. Taylor
  • David James George Watson
  • Tom Reader
ArticleOpen Access02 Jul 2025

entry.title: Functional amyloid proteins confer defence against predatory bacteria (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Functional amyloid proteins confer defence against predatory bacteria

Escherichia coli uses curli fibres, oligomers of the functional amyloid CsgA, as a barrier to protect against the predatory bacteria Bdellovibrio bacteriovorus and Myxococcus xanthus in a mechanism that is independent of genes required for biofilm formation.

  • Hannah E. Ledvina
  • Ryan Sayegh
  • Aaron T. Whiteley
Article02 Jul 2025

entry.title: Plants monitor the integrity of their barrier by sensing gas diffusion (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Plants monitor the integrity of their barrier by sensing gas diffusion

A study using Arabidopsis shows that plants can monitor the integrity of their outer barriers by sensing gas diffusion, enabling them to initiate wound repair to prevent water loss and pathogen entry.

  • Hiroyuki Iida
  • Isidro Abreu
  • Ari Pekka Mähönen
ArticleOpen Access02 Jul 2025

entry.title: A mouse brain stereotaxic topographic atlas with isotropic 1-μm resolution (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
A mouse brain stereotaxic topographic atlas with isotropic 1-μm resolution

A stereotaxic atlas of the whole mouse brain, based on a Nissl-stained cytoarchitecture dataset with isotropic 1-μm resolution, achieved through continuous micro-optical sectioning tomography, promises to be a versatile brainsmatics tool for studying the whole brain at single-cell level.

  • Zhao Feng
  • Xiangning Li
  • Qingming Luo
ArticleOpen Access02 Jul 2025

entry.title: Whole-genome ancestry of an Old Kingdom Egyptian (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Whole-genome ancestry of an Old Kingdom Egyptian

Whole-genome sequencing of an ancient male Egyptian revealed a mixture of North African Neolithic and eastern Fertile Crescent ancestry, suggesting human migration between Egypt and Mesopotamia by the Old Kingdom period.

  • Adeline Morez Jacobs
  • Joel D. Irish
  • Linus Girdland-Flink
ArticleOpen Access02 Jul 2025

entry.title: The mutagenic forces shaping the genomes of lung cancer in never smokers (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
The mutagenic forces shaping the genomes of lung cancer in never smokers

An analysis of data from the Sherlock-Lung study provides insight into the mutational processes that contribute to lung cancer in never smokers, and looks at the possible role of factors such as air pollution and passive smoking.

  • Marcos Díaz-Gay
  • Tongwu Zhang
  • Maria Teresa Landi
Article02 Jul 2025

entry.title: Mapping and engineering RNA-driven architecture of the multiphase nucleolus (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Mapping and engineering RNA-driven architecture of the multiphase nucleolus

Spatially segregated rRNA processing dictates nucleolar morphology and drives outward progression of pre-ribosomal RNA through nucleolar phases.

  • Sofia A. Quinodoz
  • Lifei Jiang
  • Clifford P. Brangwynne
ArticleOpen Access02 Jul 2025

entry.title: Trade-offs in aviation impacts on climate favour non-CO2 mitigation (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Trade-offs in aviation impacts on climate favour non-CO2 mitigation

A climate-trade-off risk curve derived from uncertainties in the radiative-forcing components indicates that focusing on reducing contrails or nitrogen oxide emissions is more effective than reducing CO2 emissions.

  • Michael J. Prather
  • Andrew Gettelman
  • Joyce E. Penner
Article02 Jul 2025

entry.title: Energy–speed relationship of quantum particles challenges Bohmian mechanics (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Energy–speed relationship of quantum particles challenges Bohmian mechanics

The study of the relationship between particle speed and negative kinetic energy, arising in regions in which, according to classical mechanics, particles are not allowed to enter, reveals behaviour that appears to contradict the predictions of Bohmian mechanics.

  • Violetta Sharoglazova
  • Marius Puplauskis
  • Jan Klaers
ArticleOpen Access02 Jul 2025

entry.title: Range extender mediates long-distance enhancer activity (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Range extender mediates long-distance enhancer activity

The REX element is associated with long-range enhancer–promoter interactions.

  • Grace Bower
  • Ethan W. Hollingsworth
  • Evgeny Z. Kvon
ArticleOpen Access02 Jul 2025

entry.title: Ancient DNA reveals the prehistory of the Uralic and Yeniseian peoples (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Ancient DNA reveals the prehistory of the Uralic and Yeniseian peoples

Genome-wide sequencing of 180 ancient individuals shows a continuous gradient of ancestry in Early-to-Mid-Holocene hunter-gatherers from the Baltic to the Transbaikal region and distinct contemporaneous groups in Northeast Siberia, and provides insights into the origins of modern Uralic and Yeniseian speakers.

  • Tian Chen Zeng
  • Leonid A. Vyazov
  • David Reich
Article02 Jul 2025

entry.title: Hybrid quantum network for sensing in the acoustic frequency range (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Hybrid quantum network for sensing in the acoustic frequency range

A hybrid quantum network combining entangled light with an atomic spin ensemble engineered to act as a negative-mass oscillator enables frequency-dependent quantum noise reduction for measurements in the acoustic noise frequency range relevant for gravitational-wave detection.

  • Valeriy Novikov
  • Jun Jia
  • Eugene Simon Polzik
ArticleOpen Access02 Jul 2025

entry.title: Electron flow in hydrogenotrophic methanogens under nickel limitation (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Electron flow in hydrogenotrophic methanogens under nickel limitation

Two distantly related methanogens shift the methanogenic pathway under nickel limitation, suggesting that methanogens adapt to changing bioavailability of nickel by rerouting electron flow between two different pathways.

  • Shunsuke Nomura
  • Pablo San Segundo-Acosta
  • Seigo Shima
ArticleOpen Access02 Jul 2025

entry.title: Rewiring endogenous genes in CAR T cells for tumour-restricted payload delivery (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Rewiring endogenous genes in CAR T cells for tumour-restricted payload delivery

A CRISPR knock-in strategy that uses endogenous gene regulatory mechanisms can engineer ‘armoured’ CAR T cells that secrete proinflammatory cytokines directly within a tumour without causing toxicity, leading to prolonged survival in mice.

  • Amanda X. Y. Chen
  • Kah Min Yap
  • Paul A. Beavis
ArticleOpen Access02 Jul 2025

entry.title: Inter-brain neural dynamics in biological and artificial intelligence systems (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Inter-brain neural dynamics in biological and artificial intelligence systems

Shared inter-brain neural dynamics, reflecting aspects of social interaction including self and other’s behaviours, arise in GABAergic neurons of the dorsomedial prefrontal cortex of socially interacting mice, as well as in the neurons of socially interacting artificial intelligence agents.

  • Xingjian Zhang
  • Nguyen Phi
  • Weizhe Hong
Article02 Jul 2025

entry.title: Close-in planet induces flares on its host star (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Close-in planet induces flares on its host star

Planet-induced flares on HIP 67522, a 17 million-year-old G dwarf star with two known close-in planets, were detected.

  • Ekaterina Ilin
  • Harish K. Vedantham
  • Hritam Chakraborty
Article02 Jul 2025

entry.title: A foundation model to predict and capture human cognition (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
A foundation model to predict and capture human cognition

A computational model called Centaur, developed by fine-tuning a language model on a huge dataset called Psych-101, can predict and simulate human nature in experiments expressible in natural language, even in previously unseen situations.

  • Marcel Binz
  • Elif Akata
  • Eric Schulz
ArticleOpen Access02 Jul 2025

entry.title: WSTF nuclear autophagy regulates chronic but not acute inflammation (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
WSTF nuclear autophagy regulates chronic but not acute inflammation

During chronic but not acute inflammation, chromatin remodelling is influenced by nuclear autophagy through WSTF interaction with ATG8 in the nucleus, leading to WSTF nuclear export and its subsequent degradation.

  • Yu Wang
  • Vinay V. Eapen
  • Zhixun Dou
Article02 Jul 2025
